Coronaviruses (of the family coronaviridae) are a group of related single‐stranded, positive sense, enveloped RNA viruses. They are the largest known RNA viruses, ranging from 26 to32 kilobases in size.
7 They are named after their appearance under electron microscopy, showing crown or halo (solar corona)‐like spikes (virions) on their surface.
8 These viruses are capable of causing illness in humans and other mammals as well as birds.
